doc.field: Fire Department of the City of New York Logbooks and Reports
Fire Department of the City of New York Logbooks and Reports

Collection of logbooks and reports from the Fire Department of the City of New York. Logbooks from various Engine Companies and Hook and Ladder Companies constitute the majority of the collection. These volumes date from 1870 to 1957, and document the day-to-day workings of the firehouses. Additional volumes, dated 1893-1913, contain Fire Chiefs' records, assignments to duty, and fire alarm signals.

Collection of logbooks and reports from the Fire Department of the City of New York. Logbooks from various Engine Companies and Hook and Ladder Companies constitute the majority of the collection. These volumes date from 1870 to 1957, and document the day-to-day workings of the firehouses. Additional volumes, dated 1893-1913, contain Fire Chiefs' records, assignments to duty, and fire alarm signals.

This collection consists of logbooks and reports from the Fire Department of the City of New York, dating from 1870 to 1957. Logbooks chronicle the daily activities of various FDNY Engine companies and Hook and Ladder companies. Entries record roll call, meals, firemen going on/off street patrol or house patrol, alarms received, care of horses, equipment checks, etc. Most volumes list the names and addresses of the company's firemen. Entries in red ink are by officers; entries in black ink by other members of the company. Also included are volumes containing chiefs' records, alarm signals, and duty assignments.
Donor information is lacking for other volumes.
